title: AITA for not wanting to go to my parents this Christmas?
self_text: Hey all,  Me (27f) and my family grew up with a lot of Christmas traditions. On Christmas evening we celebrate with me, my parents and my sisters (M and S) in our own house. Christmas Day we celebrate with the entire family of my mom at my grandma's, and on Boxing day we go to my dad's parents.   This was definitely so much fun when we were younger, but when all the grandchildren grew older and got boyfriends and girlfriends the planning got more difficult because everyone would have in-laws to go to as well. But we managed. Last two years we didn't celebrate at my grandma's because of covid (we all went seperately).  In april I was unemployed and bought an Interrailticket to travel unlimited by train for one month. I wanted to go to Norway, Sweden and Denmark but suddenly I got a job, so I haven't used it yet. It is only valid for one year and this Christas break will be the only time I am able to use it.  At first I said I would go after Christmas because I know how much we love being together with the entire family again, but then... My aunt texted saying she and her children wouldn't come on Christmas days this year because of in-laws and also they didn't want to exchange presents anymore. My other aunt has always been kinda against Christmas and says she will probably go on vacation. My sister S is being an au-pair in the USA for a year so she won't be here.  That only leaves my grandma, my parents and my sister M. If I leave to Scandinavia before Christmas, I can be there 5 days longer, which is a lot in my eyes and this definitely has my preference. I don't care about celebrating Christmas on exactly these days. I would 't mind if we celebrated it a couple of days earlier. I have talked to my grandma and she's very much fine with it, she says she doesn't care as long as she gets to see us.  However my mother and my sister M are very much against it. (I don't think my dad cares a lot.) My mother texted me saying she was very disappointed and that I made it seem like I would only come if my aunts came.  I have always had a rough relationship with my mother and M and it is no surprise to me that they are on the same side, but I also feel like I just want to stand my ground. I am 27, and I can spend my Christmas however I feel like it. If they think that celebrating Christmas on exactly those days is more important than having me there, then that's

title: AITA for wanting to leave my mum to go live with my grandmother
self_text: I (19M) currently live with my mum and have done for 7-8 years after she gained custody over me. I also live with my step dad and my two siblings aged 3 and 8. I love them all with all my heart and I wouldn't be the way I am without them but as of recent I have been struggling alot with my mental health and jumping from job to job to find my place and be happy. It started after I came out of the military for frequent panic attacks. I'm currently work as a service desk analyst and am still not happy with what I'm doing in life. Now here is where the worst part comes in... living at home with five people can be very chaotic and alot goes down, from the parents fighting, to the kids misbehaving im always stuck in the middle needing to sort out the aftermath like look after the kids on my time off doing most of the chores which I have no issue in doing so but when I get home from a nine to five and get told not asked to clean the kitchen or anything along those lines and I can't seem to have any time to myself. Its not just the chores its alot of things that are asked of me to do so which makes it seem as if my parents are being bone idol or lazy like when I'm upstairs they call me down to make a coffee for them

title: Period Trackers for Daughters
self_text: Hi everyone. We are after an app that lets us track our daughters (3 girls) periods. Are there any Apps that will let you allow to track multiple periods? Thanks üòä Edit: Thank you for all who took their time and reply! I was not expecting that much controversy. We are not from the US, so cultural differences might play a role in that aswell. As our kids quietly share pretty much everything about their bodies and periods, it's not a privacy issue for us. They do tell us when they get their periods, sometimes it would be nice to be a step ahead though. We had two incidents in the last 5 days where one went away with Basketball. (She got asked if she needed to take supplies which she denied. A few hours and a phone call later I was on the road delivering a new set of undies and supplies. Supposedly she couldn't remember when her last period was and just was too excited to leave for Basketball in the morning to stay and take supplies. Other daughter came home crying from school yesterday because her best friend wasn't talking to her as much. And it was the end of the world. When she got her period this morning it made it a lot easier for us and her to understand why she was so emotional. (We are not here to dismiss every emotion and possible mental health issue just because they are on their period, but sometimes it gives us a perspective. ) So in short, if we as parents know that they are about to get their period we can help them navigate through it, be it managing their emotions, making a comfy weekend at home instead of going to the beach, and having all the supplies of they are going somewhere (Especially the younger one) When I was younger I used a calendar, but now using an App on my phone for my own period and was just wondering if there was something out there that would let me add my daughters aswell

The school does have a zero tolerance for violence policy. My husband is concerned it will make matters worse and he will just get bullied more. My response to this was then we keep addressing it or have the bully kid moved from the class. He doesn‚Äôt want the kid moved from the class. What does everyone think?

title: Best way to remove burnt sugar from a saucepan?
self_text: I burned some sugar while caramelizing onions and now the saucepan has a thick layer of hardened sugar stuck to the bottom. I‚Äôve tried boiling water, but it‚Äôs not budging. Any tips on effectively removing this without damaging the pan?

title: AITA for telling my neighbor that if he wanted to use my driveway he had to shovel it.
self_text: The houses on my block have a service road in front of them and an alley behind. I don't like parking in the back of my garage and then walking all the way through my garage then my yard then coming in the back door. It is a pain in the butt. I always park in front of my house because my truck will not fit in my garage. My neighbor's garage has doors that open towards my driveway but my doors point towards the alley. Together we have a massive driveway. The nice older couple that lived there before had a snowblower and would clear off both driveways. They didn‚Äôt do this for me because, like I said, I don‚Äôt use that driveway at all. I have a very short front walkway and the sidewalk is covered over by pine trees. So we had a large dump of snow yesterday and my neighbor shovelled their driveway. But not mine. When they got home they tried to just drive over the snow on mine. They got stuck. So they came over and told me that I needed to shovel my driveway. I said no and said I wouldn‚Äôt be using it all winter and if they wanted to drive over it they should probably clear it off themselves. They called me an irresponsible dick and said they were calling the city. As long as my trash is in the proper container at the end of my driveway the city does not care. So I just shovel a strip out the where I need to leave my garbage.

title: AITA for not wanting to go to my parents this Christmas?
self_text: Hey all,  Me (27f) and my family grew up with a lot of Christmas traditions. On Christmas evening we celebrate with me, my parents and my sisters (M and S) in our own house. Christmas Day we celebrate with the entire family of my mom at my grandma's, and on Boxing day we go to my dad's parents.   This was definitely so much fun when we were younger, but when all the grandchildren grew older and got boyfriends and girlfriends the planning got more difficult because everyone would have in-laws to go to as well. But we managed. Last two years we didn't celebrate at my grandma's because of covid (we all went seperately).  In april I was unemployed and bought an Interrailticket to travel unlimited by train for one month. I wanted to go to Norway, Sweden and Denmark but suddenly I got a job, so I haven't used the ticket yet. It is only valid for one year and this Christas break will be the only time I am able to use it.  So my question is: How do you deal with this kind of situations?  Some background about me: I grew up in a non-european/non-american country, and beating is a thing when children are misbehaving, even in public places, people may frown upon it, but it is seen as part of children‚Äôs education and the efficient punishment for unruly children. I know it is not the right thing to do, and that‚Äôs why I am not doing it, and will never do.  Sorry for bad english

title: Saying goodbye to my parents
self_text: I'm moving out of my parents house for the first time in my life. I'm 28 years old, and I've lived there my entire life. It's hard to imagine a life outside of this household. It feels weird to be stepping out on my own and to no longer be dependent on them. My mom is sad and crying about it and my dad is trying to act strong but I can see he's clearly upset too. I know they're proud of me and that they want me to be happy, but I feel like I'm abandoning them. I'm terrified of disappointing them, and I'm worried that they'll regret letting me go. I feel guilty about leaving them, even though I know it's the right thing to do.

title: Period trackers for daughters
self_text: Hi everyone. We are after an app that lets us track our daughters periods (3 girls)  Are there any Apps that will let you allow to track multiple periods? Thanks üòä  Edit:  Thank you for all who took their time and reply!  I was not expecting that much controversy. We are not from the US, so cultural diffrences might play a role in that aswell. As our kids quiet happily share pretty much everything about their body's and periods, it's not a privacy issues for us. They do tell us when they get their periods, sometimes it would be nice to be a step ahead though. We had two incidents in the last 5 days where one went away with Basketball. (She got asked if she needed to take supplies which she denied. A few hours and a phone call later I was on the road delivering a new set of undies and supplies. Supposedly she couldn't remember when her last period was and just was too excited to leave for Basketball in the morning to stay and take supplies. Other daughter came home crying from school yesterday because her best friend wasn't talking to her as much. And it was the end of the world. When she got her period this morning it made it a lot easier for us and her to understand why she was so emotional. (We are not here to dismiss every emotion and possible mental health issue  just because they are on their period, but sometimes it gives us a perspective. )  So in short, if we as parents know that they are about to get their period we can help them navigate through it, be it managing their emotions, making a comfy weekend at home instead of going to the beach, and having all the supplies of they are going somewhere (Especially the younger one)   When I was younger I used a calendar, but now using an App on my phone for my own period and was just wondering if there was something out there that would let me add my daughters aswell

title: AITA for wanting to leave my mums to go live with my grandmother
self_text: I (m19) currently live with my mum and have done for 7-8 years after she gained custody over me. I also live with my step dad and my two siblings aged 3 and 8. I love them all with all my heart and I wouldn't be the way I am without them but as of recent I have been struggling alot with my mental health and jumping from job to job to find my place and be happy. It started after I came out of the military for frequent panic attacks. I‚Äôm currently work as a service desk analyst and am still not happy with what I‚Äôm doing in life. Now here is where the worst part comes in... living at home with five people can be very chaotic and alot goes down, from the parents fighting, to the kids misbehaving im always stuck in the middle needing to sort out the aftermath like look after the kids on my time off doing most of the chores which I have no issue in doing so but when I get home from a nine to five and get told not asked to clean the kitchen or anything along those lines and I can‚Äôt seem to have any time to myself. Its not just the chores its alot of things that are asked of me to do so which makes it seem as if my parents are being bone idol or lazy like when I‚Äôm upstairs they call me down to make a coffee for them both, going to the shop to fetch something. I understand its nice to have help every now and then but every day through the week im getting 2-3 hours before I go to sleep for my own time to talk to my friends etc. My grandmother who practically raised me along with my mum in my younger years has seen my parents almost rely on my doing anything otherwise it doesn‚Äôt get done witch my grandmother frequently gets into arguments with my mum saying "if he wasn‚Äôt here what would you do‚Äù. After alot of consideration and talking to my friends, myself and I belive for my mental state thinks that it would be better to live with my grandmother so I have more leg room to live my life and not be stuck at home or told of for wanting to go anywhere outside the house that doesn‚Äôt involve helping them in which case they would call me selfish I

title: Saying goodbye to my goldfish
self_text: My goldfish, Finny, has been getting increasingly lethargic over the past few days. His appetite has diminished, and he spends most of his time at the bottom of his tank. I‚Äôve cleaned his tank thoroughly, adjusted the temperature, and added a little extra food, but nothing seems to improve his condition. After consulting with a local fish store employee, I suspect Finny is suffering from a bacterial infection or perhaps kidney disease. Sadly, the employee advised that there's not much I can do to cure his illness, and he‚Äôs unlikely to recover. I've grown incredibly attached to Finny over the past three years‚Äîhe was a gift from my grandfather. I‚Äôm struggling with the decision of whether to euthanize him. It feels cruel, but I don't want to prolong his suffering. I‚Äôm unsure of the proper procedure and how to carry it out humanely. Any guidance or resources you could offer would be greatly appreciated.

title: AITA for not wanting to go to my parents this Christmas?
self_text: Hey all,  Me (27f) and my family grew up with a lot of Christmas traditions. On Christmas evening we celebrate with me, my parents and my sisters (M and S) in our own house. Christmas Day we celebrate with the entire family of my mom at my grandma‚Äôs, and on Boxing day we go to my dad‚Äôs parents. I am 27, and I can spend my Christmas however I feel like it. If they think that celebrating Christmas on exactly those days is more important than having me there, then that‚Äôs their choice. title: AITA for insisting my boyfriend needs to finish the dishwasher
self_text: My boyfriend and I have been together for a year, and we share a small apartment. I do most of the housework, and he occasionally helps, but he tends to leave things half-done and then expects me to finish them. Yesterday, I loaded the dishwasher, started the cycle, and he went to watch TV. An hour later, he was still sitting on the couch and hadn't unloaded the dishwasher. I pointed out that it was still running and that he needed to unload it. He got defensive and said I was nagging him and that he was busy. I told him that it's a simple task and that it‚Äôs not fair for me to always do everything. He then proceeded to argue with me for 20 minutes. I eventually gave up and unloaded the dishwasher myself. Now he‚Äôs accusing me of being unreasonable and controlling. I feel like I'm contributing equally to the household, but he consistently avoids doing his share.
